builders Package¶

builders Package¶

The builders package

This package contains scripts that can be run to build certain designs with roco.

roco.builders.get_builder_dir()¶

Add_fingerjoint Module¶

class roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.fFingerDrawing(length, width, male=False)¶

Bases: roco.derived.composables.fegraph.drawing.Face

This class generate the basic element for finger joint decoration. It is to add the finger shape not the rectangle tab face.

Args:
w is the width of finger; t is the half of the height of finger;
class roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.fFingerJoint(length, width, male=False, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.derived.composables.fegraph.face.Face

Face class. It takes in the length of the edge and width of finger joint. Then create the coordinates for the finger joint face. Finally it generates a finger joint face.

roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.femaleFingerJoint(length, width, **kwargs)¶
roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.femaleFingerJointDecoration(face, edge, width, **kwargs)¶
class roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.mFingerDrawing(length, width, male=True)¶

Bases: roco.derived.composables.fegraph.drawing.Face

This class generate the basic element for finger joint decoration. It is to add the finger shape not the rectangle tab face.

Args:
w is the width of finger; t is the half of the height of finger;
class roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.mFingerJoint(length, width, male=True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: roco.derived.composables.fegraph.face.Face

Face class. It takes in the length of the edge and width of finger joint. Then create the coordinates for the finger joint face. Finally it generates a finger joint face.

roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.maleFemaleFingerJointDecoration(face, faceEdge, thick, widget, male=True, **kwargs)¶

help to find how many fingers we need for different subcomponent.And add these fingers into the face. :param face: The face we add decoration; :param faceEdge: the edge we refer to; :param thick: the width of finger, it usually is 3.0mm. :param male: the type of decoration; :param widget: a face object to represent the finger; :param kwargs: kwargs; :return: None. the decoration will be added into selected face after operation

roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.maleFemaleFingerJointDecorationDrawing(length, width, male=True)¶
Parameters:
  • length – the length of edge to add finger joint;
  • width – the width of finger joint;
Returns:

return coordinates of finger joint decoration;
roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.maleFemaleFingerJointDrawing(l, width, male=True)¶
Parameters:
  • l – the length of edge which you want to add finger joint;
  • width – the width of finger
  • male – type of finger joint, male or female
Returns:

return the coordinates of finger joint face.
roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.maleFingerJoint(length, width, **kwargs)¶
roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint.maleFingerJointDecoration(face, edge, width, **kwargs)¶

roco.builders.Add_fingerjoint2.maleFemaleFingerJointDecoration(face, faceEdge, thick, widget, male=True, **kwargs)¶

help to find how many fingers we need for different subcomponent.And add these fingers into the face. :param face: The face we add decoration; :param faceEdge: the edge we refer to; :param thick: the width of finger, it usually is 3.0mm. :param male: the type of decoration; :param widget: a face object to represent the finger; :param kwargs: kwargs; :return: None. the decoration will be added into selected face after operation
